title: Computational Thinking Education for Beginning University Students: Integrated PBL and Self-Regulated Learning Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Computer Literacy and Understanding of Fundamental Mathematical Concepts
context.additional_context: A course for working professionals to cultivate computational thinking skills for solving real-life problems, offering flexible learning environments using personal devices

learning_goals: Learners acquire the ability to design algorithms and implement programming solutions for real-life problems
Learners improve learning efficiency by 20% by applying self-regulated learning strategies during project execution
Learners are assessed on creative problem-solving skills utilizing computational thinking competencies (decomposition, abstraction, automation, generalization)

resources: Programming development environment (e.g., Python, C language)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
